P005
common risk factors and co-morbidities.

OF APREMILAST IN PATIENTS WITH MODERATE

PLAQUE PSORIASIS

Results: FAE status varies across Europe. Current European gui-
Introduction: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) including Crohn’s
delines recommend FAEs for the initial and long-term treatment
disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC) are common comor-
of psoriasis. These guidelines (based on consensus/expert opinion)
bidities associated with psoriasis, psoriatic arthritis (PsA), and
also recommend a gradual increase in dose.[2] Country-specific
ankylosing spondylitis (AS). Compared with the general popula-
guidelines vary in their individual recommendations. German
tion, epidemiological studies have shown that patients (pts) with
guidelines endorse FAEs as 1st-line treatment for moderate-to-
psoriasis or PsA are at a 2-4-fold increased risk of developing CD
severe psoriasis, based on BSA > 10% or a PASI score of > 10,
and a 2-3-fold increased risk of developing UC.1-5 Additionally,
and recommend clinical assessments after 16-24 weeks of treat-
in pts with AS, there is a 3-5-fold increased risk of IBD compared
ment.[3] UK guidelines approve FAEs only as a 2nd-line option
with the general population.6 Secukinumab is a fully human mo-
for severe plaque psoriasis (PASI ≥10 or DLQI≥ 10),[1] whilst in
noclonal antibody that neutralizes interleukin-17A and is approved
the Netherlands FAEs are indicated only for initial treatment of
for the treatment of psoriasis, PsA, and AS.
moderate-to-severe disease.[4] Swiss guidelines also recommend
Objectives: To evaluate the incidence of IBD, CD, and UC in pts
the use of FAEs for moderate-to-severe psoriasis, but only in
with psoriasis, PsA, or AS who received IL-17A-inhibition with
patients who are unresponsive to topical therapy.[5] In Sweden,
secukinumab from 21 phase 3/4 clinical trials of secukinumab for
FAEs can be considered as a 2nd-line treatment option.[6]
psoriasis, PsA, or AS.
Other country-specific guidelines are less clear. While Spanish
Methods: This analysis evaluated pooled data from fourteen phase
guidelines discuss FAEs as a slower-acting therapy requiring
3 and one phase 4 psoriasis trials, three phase 3 PsA trials, and
treatment goals to be set at week 16, no specific guidance on the
three phase 3 AS trials. Pts with a history of IBD, but not active
use of FAEs is given.[7] Likewise, while Italian guidelines men-
ongoing IBD, were eligible for enrollment in these trials. Data
tion FAEs, they are not included in treatment recommendations as
from all pts that received at least one dose of secukinumab were
they are currently not licensed in Italy.[8] In contrast, there is no
included in this analysis. IBD reporting includes cases of CD, UC,
mention of FAEs in guidelines in Denmark, Portugal and Norway.
and IBD not otherwise specified (NOS).
Conclusion: European guidelines recommend FAEs for both the

Introduction: The Fc-free, PEGylated, anti-tumor necrosis factor
NewLab Clinical Research
certolizumab pegol (CZP) has shown efficacy in chronic plaque
Introduction: Psoriasis is a chronic debilitating auto immune
psoriasis (PSO). [1,2]
disease which manifests on the skin through red scaly plaques.
Objectives: To assess the efficacy of CZP to 48 weeks across
Biologic treatment have been very successful in controlling mode-
patient (pt) demographic and baseline disease characteristic sub-
rate to severe psoriasis, however they are quite expensive and not
groups in phase 3 trials.

Results: At baseline, the mean age and weight were 49.2 years

Introduction: Tildrakizumab (TIL), a humanized, IgG1/κ mono-
lege at Metropolitan Hospital, New York, NY, 3Oregon Health & Science

studies1.
Introduction/Objective:To evaluate the efficacy, safety & tolera-
Objective:In this analysis, we examined efficacy from baseline
bility of guselkumab (GUS) in patients (pts) w/ PsA.

COMMUNICATION AND PATIENT HEALTHCARE
time and it is most common in the age group 50-69. The reported
NEEDS IN PSA

most common symptom in patients with psoriasis. Pruritus is a

MEASUREMENT OF PSORIATIC ARTHRITIS
Introduction: Psoriatic arthritis (PsA) is a chronic inflammatory
SYMPTOMS IN PSORIASIS CLINICAL TRIALS
joint disease that, if untreated, can cause joint destruction and disa-
Lourdes Perez Chada
bility. The knowledge about PsA among both public and healthcare
Harvard Medical School-Brigham and Women’s Hospital
providers is limited, leading to underdiagnosis and undertreatment.

(IDEOM) group was established to standardize patient-centered
Psoriasis Association and the Swedish Rheumatism Association
outcome measures to improve the assessment of treatment respon-
initiated a web-based educational campaign which also featured
se and disease course in dermatology. To define the measurement
a survey on healthcare experiences and Quality of Life.
